name: vsbloom
description: Overhauls VSCode's look and feel, adding a variety of animations and 'eye candy' to the UI.

commands.title: VSBloom: (Developer Debug Command: You shouldn't see this...)

vsbloom.patcher.workbenchDir.description: The path to the internal 'workbench' directory used by the VSCode Electron client. Setting this to 'auto' will attempt to locate the appropriate path automatically - it's usually located somewhere around %localappdata%\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-browser\workbench
vsbloom.patcher.workbenchDir.markdownDescription: The path to the internal 'workbench' directory used by the VSCode Electron client. Setting this to '**auto**' will attempt to locate the appropriate path automatically - it's usually located somewhere around `%localappdata%\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-browser\workbench`

vsbloom.patcher.initFiles.description: A list of HTML file names inside of the (workbenchDir) directory utilized by the VSCode Electron client when launching; the first file among the provided values found will be used as the 'injection' point for VSBloom.
vsbloom.patcher.initFiles.markdownDescription: A list of HTML file names inside of the `vsbloom.patcher.workbenchDir` directory utilized by the VSCode Electron client when launching; the **first** file among the provided values found will be used as the 'injection' point for VSBloom.

items.title: HTML File Name
items.description: The name of an HTML file to search for inside of the electron client's workbench directory for VSBloom initialization.

vsbloom.patcher.appProductFile.description: The path to the 'product.json' file associated with the VSCode application itself; setting this to 'auto' will attempt to locate the appropriate path for this file automatically - it's usually located somewhere around %localappdata%\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\product.json
vsbloom.patcher.appProductFile.markdownDescription: The path to the `product.json` file associated with the VSCode application itself; setting this to '**auto**' will attempt to locate the appropriate path for this file automatically - it's usually located somewhere around `%localappdata%\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\product.json`

vsbloom.windowFocus.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable or disable effects surrounding the window becoming unfocused *(and later refocused)*
vsbloom.windowFocus.enabled.description: Enable or disable window-focus based effects

vsbloom.windowFocus.longTermUnfocusThres.markdownDescription: A threshold - in **seconds** - for how long the window must remain unfocused: After this time the 'short-term' unfocus effect transitions into a heavier 'long-term' effect
vsbloom.windowFocus.longTermUnfocusThres.description: A threshold - in seconds - for how long the window must remain unfocused: After this time the 'short-term' unfocus effect transitions into a heavier 'long-term' effect

vsbloom.cursorTrail.enabled.description: Enable or disable the cursor trail effect

vsbloom.cursorTrail.duration.description: The lifetime - in milliseconds - of the trail that follows behind the cursor as it moves.
vsbloom.cursorTrail.duration.markdownDescription: The lifetime - in **milliseconds** - of the trail that follows behind the cursor as it moves.
